metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9589 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in PSOutputDev::setupResources() located in PSOutputDev.cc in Xpdf 4.01. It can be triggered by sending a crafted pdf file to (for example) the pdftops binary. It allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler118 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

libkpathsea6 - 2018.20181218.49446-2
libptexenc1 - 2018.20181218.49446-2
libsynctex2 - 2018.20181218.49446-2
libtexlua53 - 2018.20181218.49446-2
libtexluajit2 - 2018.20181218.49446-2
texlive-binaries - 2018.20181218.49446-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> can't reproduce with poppler, no indication it is affected code is different in texlive-bin, doesn't look vulnerable ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which doesn't contain the vulnerable code

criterions.comment: poppler package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
texlive-bin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2018.20181218.49446-2').
